title: about me

title: CV: Jarom Bradshaw
text:
Rexburg, Idaho, USA
Email | LinkedIn | 859-420-4178



Software developer with a minor in statistics, experienced in data collection, analysis, and visualization. Skilled in Python, SQL, and data processing, seeking to leverage technical and analytical expertise to build scalable, impactful solutions.






Data Science Society
September 2024 - Present, Rexburg, Idaho

Led a 12-week bootcamp, teaching foundational programming concepts to four participants through weekly one-hour sessions.

Developing a full-stack application simulating a blood donation center, managing a database of 300+ records while mentoring participants on programming principles.

Provided individual guidance, receiving positive feedback from 75% of participants for improving their understanding of MySQL and software development.

Facilitated brainstorming sessions, fostering collaboration to refine solutions and successfully meet tight deadlines.




The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints Mission Office
February 2023 - August 2023, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Facilitated communication between mission leadership, 120+ missionaries, and vendors, ensuring seamless IT support and operational efficiency.

Trained leaders on cell-phone audits, increasing compliance by 5% and identifying unauthorized software use.

Negotiated deals with tech vendors, reducing technology purchase costs by 50% and saving over 1,000 Reals on large-scale cell-phone repairs for 60+ devices.

Designed and optimized Excel tools to analyze key performance metrics, supporting data-driven decisions on baptisms and new teachings.

Engineered a maintainable IT framework utilizing Microsoft SharePoint, streamlining document management and increasing retrieval speed by 40%.








The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
March 2023 - May 2023

Researched and implemented spreadsheet automation techniques to streamline real-time missionary data tracking for 50+ missionary companionships.

Improved data accuracy and operational efficiency by 25%, enabling better decision-making under tight deadlines.

Developed automated workflows accessible to mission leaders, reducing manual effort by 40% and saving hours of processing time each week.






Computer Science | Emphasis in Machine Learning, Minor in Statistics
Brigham Young University - Idaho
September 2023 - July 2026 (Expected)

Sophomore Fall/Winter Track employed as a full-time student, consistently completing 16-19 credits per semester.






Computer Programming Certificate (Expected Completion: March 2025)

Proficient in Object-Oriented Programming, front-end development, and computer fundamentals.








Brigham Young University - Idaho | Computer Science Tutoring Lab
September 2023 - December 2023

Tutored 5-10 students weekly, guiding them through programming concepts to improve foundational skills.

Guided 1-3 students weekly through programming concepts, simplifying terms to improve understanding and boosting assignment completion rates by 20%.

Reviewed assignments and projects for at least 4 students per month, successfully debugging 90% of issues in student code and database queries.







Programming Languages: Python (Intermediate), SQL (Intermediate-Advanced, MySQL), C# (Intermediate)

Programming Paradigms: Object-Oriented Programming (Intermediate), Functional Programming (Beginner)

Data Manipulation & Analysis: Python libraries (Pandas, NumPy â€“ Beginner)

Data Visualization: Tableau (Beginner), Lets-Plot (Intermediate)

Databases & Frameworks: MySQL (Intermediate-Advanced), Database Design, Query Optimization, OSINT Framework (Beginner)

Language Skills: Fluent in Portuguese; native-level proficiency in English
